item.title: iOS 19: All the rumored changes Apple could be bringing to its new operating system
item.dc:creator: Lauren Forristal
item.description: As Apple prepares to unveil iOS 19 at WWDC 2025, several rumors have surfaced, including a potential new name for the operating system and more.

item.title: Meta reportedly in talks to invest billions of dollars in Scale AI
item.dc:creator: Anthony Ha
item.description: Meta is discussing a multi-billion dollar investment in Scale AI, according to Bloomberg. In fact, the deal value could reportedly exceed $10 billion, making it the largest external AI investment for the Facebook parent company and one of the largest funding events ever for a private company.

item.title: WWDC 2025: What to expect from this year’s conference
item.dc:creator: Lauren Forristal, Sarah Perez
item.description: At WWDC 2025, Apple will likely focus on the next iOS, which is rumored to have the most significant design change since the introduction of iOS 7.

item.title: Axiom Space prepares for its fourth mission to the ISS
item.dc:creator: Anthony Ha
item.description: Axiom Space plans to launch its fourth mission on Tuesday, June 10 — a mission that CEO Tejpaul Bhatia described as “a little bit of a victory lap.”

item.title: Pioneering Apple engineer Bill Atkinson dies at 74
item.dc:creator: Anthony Ha
item.description: Bill Atkinson, an engineer who played a key role in the development of the Macintosh and other landmark Apple products, has died of pancreatic cancer.

item.title: How to watch Apple’s WWDC 2025 keynote
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description: Apple is expected to unveil changes to its operating systems iOS, iPadOS, macOS, watchOS, tvOS, and visionOS at its Worldwide Developers Conference.

item.title: At WWDC 25, Apple should make amends with developers after AI shortfalls and lawsuits
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description: Apple has an opportunity to deliver a WWDC that would encourage developers to invest more of their time in the ecosystem.

item.title: Lawyers could face ‘severe’ penalties for fake AI-generated citations, UK court warns
item.dc:creator: Anthony Ha
item.description:
he High Court of England and Wales says lawyers need to take stronger steps to prevent the misuse of artificial intelligence in their work.
In a ruling tying together two recent cases, Judge Victoria Sharp wrote that generative AI tools like ChatGPT “are not capable of conducting reliable legal research."

item.title: Trump administration takes aim at Biden and Obama cybersecurity rules
item.dc:creator: Anthony Ha
item.description: In a White House fact sheet, the administration claims that Biden’s Executive Order 14144 — signed days before the end of his presidency — was an attempt “to sneak problematic and distracting issues into cybersecurity policy.”

item.title: Week in Review: Why Anthropic cut access to Windsurf
item.dc:creator: Karyne Levy
item.description: Welcome back to Week in Review! Got lots for you today, including why Windsurf lost access to Claude, ChatGPT’s new features, WWDC 2025, Elon Musk’s fight with Donald Trump, and lots more. Have a great weekend! Duh: During an interview at TC Sessions: AI 2025, Anthropic’s co-founder had a perfectly reasonable explanation for why the […]

item.title: Will Musk vs. Trump affect xAI’s $5 billion debt deal?
item.dc:creator: Anthony Ha
item.description: While the online feud between Elon Musk and President Donald Trump seemed to drive traffic to Musk’s social media platform X (formerly Twitter), it could also create issues for the platform’s parent company xAI.

item.title: Superblocks CEO: How to find a unicorn idea by studying AI system prompts
item.dc:creator: Julie Bort
item.description: Brad Menezes, CEO of enterprise vibe coding startup Superblocks, is convinced that the next crop of billion-dollar startup ideas are hiding in almost plain sight: system prompts.

item.title: After its data was wiped, KiranaPro’s co-founder cannot rule out an external hack
item.dc:creator: Jagmeet Singh
item.description: Exclusive: The company's co-founder and CTO blame a former employee for a breach, but cannot rule out that it wasn't.

item.title: Meet the Finalists: VivaTech’s 5 Most Visionary Startups of 2025
item.dc:creator: Cindy Zackney
item.description: Narrowing down the 30 most visionary startups of the year to just five finalists was no easy feat. VivaTech’s Innovation of the Year attracted an extraordinary pool of applicants—startups tackling massive global challenges with bold, technically sophisticated, and scalable solutions. From redefining human-machine interaction to revolutionizing healthcare, climate, and infrastructure, each company brought something unique […]

item.title: Trump fast-tracks supersonic travel, amid spate of flight-related executive orders
item.dc:creator: Connie Loizos
item.description: President Donald Trump signed an executive order directing the Federal Aviation Administration to lift the 52-year ban on supersonic flight over U.S. soil.

item.title: TechCrunch Mobility: How Jony Ive’s LoveFrom helped Rivian and what Uber’s next-generation playbook looks like
item.dc:creator: Kirsten Korosec
item.description: Welcome back to TechCrunch Mobility — your central hub for news and insights on the future of transportation.

item.title: Omada Health IPO signals healthier market, avoids ‘down-round’ trend
item.dc:creator: Marina Temkin
item.description: Omada Health popped in its first day as a public company, validation for founder CEO Sean Duffy.

item.title: 2025 will be a ‘pivotal year’ for Meta’s augmented and virtual reality, says CTO
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Bellan
item.description: Andrew "Boz" Bosworth, Meta's CTO, says 2025 will be a pivotal year for Reality Labs, the company's augmented and virtual reality unit.

item.title: Why investing in growth-stage AI startups is getting riskier and more complicated
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Bellan
item.description: AI startups are reaching growth stage much faster. That's exciting, but also risky, because investors might pour millions into a company only to watch it be unseated in a few months.

item.title: Anthropic appoints a national security expert to its governing trust
item.dc:creator: Kyle Wiggers
item.description: Anthropic's long-term benefit trust is a governance mechanism that Anthropic claims helps it promote safety over profit, and which has the power to elect some of the company's board of directors.
